results.title: Does Dracula have Aids?
results.creator_credit: John Lander, Ken Chown and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hypothetical (Television Program)”.
AIDS is the most publicised and least understood disease in Australia. This video may help to clear up some of the confusion as the discoverer of the AIDS virus, Professor Luc Montagnier, joins Australia’s most experienced AIDS specialists and community leaders to confront the ethical and social dilemmas created by the disease. Geoffrey Robertson’s Hypothetical on AIDS was filmed on 12th August, 1986.

results.title: Does anybody need me anymore?
results.creator_credit: Paul Bogart and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Part of the “Being a woman” series. Observes the changes which occur in the marriage of a middle-aged couple when the wife decides to change her own lifestyle after her children are grown and gone. Raises issues regarding women’s roles, sex-role stereotyping, changing expectaions of the female role and the male perception of such topics.

results.title: Does advertising pay?
results.creator_credit: Alan Strowger, Tony Matthews and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marketing”.
In 1965 British industry spent nearly 600 million pounds on advertising and sales promotion. Was the money well spent? Part of a series of films designed to present the theory and practice of modern marketing. Case histories of branded products (failures as well as successes) are given to illustrate particular market problems.

results.title: DoDo the circus star
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas, Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode the Professor is jealous of DoDo who has become a star circus attraction and media darling. In his attempt to outdo DoDo, the Professor ends up creating total chaos and being arrested. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

results.title: Dodo in Pukcab Land
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas, Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode DoDo saves the day for the absent-minded Professor Fingers when he diverts the train the Professor is travelling on from a collision - only problem is DoDo diverts the train into Pukcab Land where everything is backwards. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

results.title: DoDo helps Interpol
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas, Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode DoDo helps Interpol catch card cheats on an ocean liner. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

results.title: DoDo buys a space pig
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas, Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode DoDo and Professor Fingers cause havoc at a cosmic animal show when Professor Fingers becomes jealous over DoDo buying a lovable long-eared space pig. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode DoDo and Professor Fingers cause havoc at a cosmic animal show when Professor Fingers becomes jealous over DoDo buying a lovable long-eared space pig. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

results.title: DoDo at the rodeo
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas, Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 50 of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode DoDo learns to ride a horse, perform at a rodeo and join in a square dance. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

results.brief_description:
Episode number 20 of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode DoDo saves the performance of an opera diva. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.
